reviewText:
Just finished playing this game to completion (upgrading all cars, etc), and I have to say it was pretty cool.
Items of note for you who are interested:
• It's an online game - you connet to servers (JP, EU or US based on your locale), so ultimately it's a multiplayer, like a simple version of Trackmania or similar.
• Graphically, it's not going to blow your socks off [mobile port I believe], but it makes up for that in charm, with 30 different vehicles, each with their own characteristics (engine sounds, horns, boost effects, handling).
• While only 4 tracks, and a tank battle level, there are various things you do in each one, from collecting coins, accumulating stunt points, racing, tagging objects, find the ring, and king of the crown, it doesn't get too boring if you like to be competitive, and in there to enjoy the game.
• No in level or lobby for chat! A MP game like this could benefit so much from this, would make it's stay a lot more welcome, something I'd come back to if it had this.
• There are a few glitches - getting stuck in certain places, points sometimes mess-up in the tag matches, and sometimes you lose connection to the server (that last one doesn't affect your progress, so don't freak out) - but I was able to overlook this as didn't have high expectations of a game that's only like $5

I really enjoyed this game, and if things like chat/interaction with players was added, more levels, and some of the glitches were fixed (points-glitch in particular), this would be something I'd see people stick around to play longer. Recommended game - 2-pack for $5 is a no-brainer - dive in with a mate, and get playing!

reviewText:
Frantic, fast-paced, bright, colorful, incredibly fun and addictive. ... How many other games do you know of that let you do backflips in a schoolbus?

It may look and feel like a mobile game, but don't be fooled. There's plenty of content here to keep you occupied for hours. There's around 30 different vehicles, all of which fit within three different classes and can be maxed out in terms of stats (speed, handling, boost, etc). The core game itself spans across four very different and unique levels, all of which are played online with others in lobbies supporting up to 10 players (roughly) each. The gameplay consists of freeroam mixed with about four or five quick events that are constantly playing on rotation during gameplay that anybody else in the same lobby / map  can participate in. Each event is unique in its own way, and are a complete blast to play.

Oh yeah. There's also a bonus unlockable tank battle gamemode which by itself is almost a completely different game that is quite honestly insanely addictive and fun. I really don't think I've ever had so much fun with a mobile port before.

I almost feel bad for having purchased this on sale!

reviewText:
Don't get fooled by the positive reviews like i was. Everything about this game is very shallow.

There are 4 worlds(maps), but they aren't very big at all, they are actually rather small and the first world(Canyon) is actually rather tiny.
There are 30 cars, but they are all pretty much the same with next to NO diffrence in stats (There are no stats, all of the cars control the same except the later cars are sligtly faster then the beggining cars).
The only car stats is that the cars are devided in three categories: Light, Medium, Heavy. The problem is that they all control the same with the only difference being that the Light cars are a slightly faster, the Heavy cars are a slightly better at stunting and the Medium ones are somewhere in the middle(aleast from what i have seen, this is never explained in-game).
The mechanics are shallow. You can only do backflips, frontflips and move the car left or right doing 180, 360, 720 and 1080 turns midair(sorry, i don't know whats the real name of that trick if it even has one). The cars fly around on even the slightest bump and that can get annoying.
There are 6 minigames(events) that happen randomly in the game but most are very shallow. Here is why:

1. Find the ring event: There are always a few rings in every world, and when this event starts one of those rings turns blue and you have to get to it first in order to win.
The problem is that the player who is closest to the ring will probably win (unless the closest player makes some stupid mistake) so its completly luck based.

2. Racing event: All you have to do is go thru all of the checkpoints to win.
The problem is that ALL of these races take place on the flat terrain on the maps instead of useing any of the many props in the worlds so they are rather boring.
But the BIGGEST problem is that ALL of these races are very short, they last around 30 to 40 seconds. That happens because, again, the worlds are rather small.

3. Tag event: You have to stunt on as many of the props(and thus ''tag'' them) and you have to have the most props tagged before time runs out in order to win.
This event isn't actually all that bad. It makes sense that such an event exists since this game has alot of focus on stunting.
The only problem is that 2/4 worlds have specific places that you kinda have to go to in order to win cause they are filled with props.

4. Stunt event: Get the most amount of points by stunting before time ends.
This isn't HORRIBLE, but its shallow because you can easily win most of the matches by just doing the same stunt over and over again.

5. King of the crown: A random player gets the crown and has to keep it for 60 seconds to win, and the other players can win by hitting the player with the crown so they can take it.
It sounds good on paper but because of the mechanics and the fact that on even the slightest bump your car flyes around, it can be a pain sometimes to hit the guy with the crown, and 50% of the time the guy who randomly gets the crown at the start is the one who wins.

6. Coin collect event: Collect the most amount of coins before the time ends to win.
This one is completly fine, no real problems with it.

There are some bugs, most aren't all that annoying except the bug where you clip thru a prop and usually you are stuck there then you have to re-enter the world, thus you lose the event.

There is usually more then enough players in the game playing so don't ever enter an empty server(but sometimes when you are not playing at peak hours there won't be more then 6 players on any server).

There is no way to comunicate with other players.

The graphics are mobile tier(thats because this is a port of the mobile version of the game), but thats not important. What IS important is the sound, and the sounds are OK, but the music gets repetitive.

There is also a seprate Tank Battle mode, but its nohing special.
You start with the regular tank, you can buy 4 diffrent tank that all have diffrent stats(Yes, the tanks have actual stats).
You have around 5 VERY tiny areas that are in the sky, and the way you win is by shooting another player so that he flys out of the area and then that gets counted as a kill (yes, you just push them, they don't actually explode).
As you may see, the Tank Battle mode isn't all that great and there are other games (and mods for other games) that do a better job, but its not bad. Its OK.

But do you want to know the BIGGEST problem with the game? The game can be played for FREE on Android/Iphone AND it can be played for free on the web browser! So this game, even with the free copy, isn't worth 1 euro, let alone 5 ♥♥♥♥ING EUROS.

reviewText:
It's like the poor man's version of something like The Crew and that's not a bad thing!.

A mostly open world map where you play on 5 different maps along with other people also playing the game on that same map. You start off with the first and last levels, the latter being a tank versus map. to progress you must perform certain stunts to reach rings to collect them, get a certain amount of points, and win a few events.

Events consist of racing, taging ramps and other objects to color them while keeping hold of them by getting big scores off of them, collecting coins, performing stunts and getting the highest score, a sort of tag mode where you must keep the crown away from others or get it yourself and get your timer to zero to win, and a find the ring event where you must look for the ring that you must reach first to win.

There are various cars to win and unlock by raising your player level and maxing out your cars' levels, 4 that are unlocked by beating the vehicles in a race on your own (1v1). Each vehicle has four stats: Top Speed- raised by simply staying at the top speed for an extended amount of time, Acceleration- raised by just accelerating, Handling- raised by drifting, and Nitro- raised by using your boost. Once you reach the required player level and amount of cars' stats maxed out, which you can buy out depending on how much progress was made, you use the in game cash to buy the vehicle for use.

I highly recommend this game to any racing game fans or anyone just looking for some good clean fun! It's cheap and comes with an extra copy to share with a friend. A game that deserves a look, go ahead buy it!

reviewText:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=F4TXlRaJMfU
Crash Drive 2 is a port of a mobile game to Steam and it's got a lot of ridiculous driving, crashing, spinning, and flipping.  But is it worth your time?  Let's find out in this review on Crash Drive 2.

Crash Drive 2 is a pretty simple game.  You pick your car, get out on a multiplayer course with other drivers, and complete objective based events.  The different events include setting a high score, tagging various objects, and being the first to reach a certain ring.  The game is pure mayhem and silly fun as you bump into other players and there's no consequence.  Cars take no damage and most of the time you will land on your wheels.  Even if you don't land upright, chances are you'll easily flip over.  There are five different levels and you must complete a few tasks in order to advance.  You'll have to set a high score, drive through all of the rings one time, and complete a number of events to unlock the next level.

So multiplayer is crucial and it's the point of the game.  Whenever you join a level you're instantly matchmade with other players so you never know who you'll end up with.  Am I really playing with PewDiePie? Probably not, but that's funny.

There's also a ton of different cars to unlock.  There's lightweight and fast sports cars, then there are big monster trucks and fire trucks.  The trucks are fun for crashing into your opponents, but the sports cars will let you get tons of air.  Oh Yeah!

There's also a crazy tank battle mode that you get to unlock later.  The tanks can shoot and you can blow your opponents away.  Tank battle mode is probably the craziest because you are on a floating platform and you get points by knocking other people off.  It's total mayhem. Tank battle mode is like a different game, but it's also fun to play.

The graphics are probably the weakest part of the game.  Since it's a mobile port, it doesn't take advantage of PC power and there are no advanced graphics settings.  Some of the texture are pretty bad, especially in the first level.  The barriers that surround the level are just like warped end points.  They could have done a better job with this.  The plus side is that it does run very well, I maxed out at 144 frames per second and didn't really experience any lag.

There were also a few bugs, I got stuck on a tree once or twice but I was able to reset my position by hitting start even though the game doesn't indicate this.  I also had some disconnects during multiplayer sessions.

Crash Drive 2 is only $5 on Steam so it may be fun to mess around and drive like a maniac for a bit.  If you like silly games and want to relax from a grueling shooter session, Crash Drive 2 can be a fun distraction. I found this game to be a lot of fun.  Simple and engaging.

Can completely ignore the activities if you want to!

All cars seems to drive alike, with minor tweeks (This one goes faster then that one, etc.)  Including the Tank!!
